Semilocalizations of the Integers
In this package, the semilocalizations \Z_{(\pi)} of the ring of integers are used as base rings for unions of residue classes.
Entering semilocalizations of the integers
The ring \Z_{(\pi)} resp. the ring \Z_p.
The returned ring has the property IsZ&uscore;pi. The set pi of noninvertible primes can be retrieved by the operation NoninvertiblePrimes. IsZ&uscore;pi
NoninvertiblePrimes
gap> R := Z_pi(2); Z_( 2 ) gap> S := Z_pi([2,5,7]); Z_( 2, 5, 7 )
Methods for semilocalizations of the integers
StandardAssociate Gcd Lcm Factors IsUnit
There are methods for the operations in, Intersection, IsSubset, StandardAssociate, Gcd, Lcm, Factors and IsUnit available for semilocalizations of the integers. For the documentation of these operations, see the &GAP; reference manual. The standard associate of an element of a ring \Z_{(\pi)} is defined by the product of the noninvertible prime factors of its numerator.
gap> 4/7 in R; 3/2 in R; true false gap> Intersection(R,Z_pi([3,11])); IsSubset(R,S); Z_( 2, 3, 11 ) true
gap> StandardAssociate(R,-6/7); 2 gap> Gcd(S,90/3,60/17,120/33); 10 gap> Lcm(S,90/3,60/17,120/33); 40 gap> Factors(R,840); [ 105, 2, 2, 2 ] gap> Factors(R,-2/3); [ -1/3, 2 ] gap> IsUnit(S,3/11); true
